summary: Email correspondence from New York Times reporter Matthew Goldstein to FBI contacts, inquiring about FBI investigations into Epstein foundation payments in the Virgin Islands and a search of Southern Trust offices. The email seeks confirmation of meetings between FBI agents and Virgin Islands officials regarding payments from the J Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation to settle fines, and a search of Epstein's island residence and Southern Trust offices in August 2019.

persons.name: Matthew Goldstein
persons.context: New York Times reporter who sent the email inquiry to FBI contacts about investigations into Epstein foundation payments and searches in the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Matt
persons.context: FBI contact addressed by Matthew Goldstein in the email inquiry; likely an FBI agent or public affairs officer.

persons.name: Ajthoreson
persons.context: FBI email recipient (ajthoreson@fbi.gov) copied in the correspondence regarding the Epstein foundation investigation.

connections.description: Reporter making inquiries to FBI contact about ongoing investigations.
Reporter copying FBI contact in email correspondence about Epstein foundation payments.

events.title: FBI meeting with Virgin Islands DPNR
events.description: FBI agents met with officials from the Virgin Islands Department of Planning and Natural Resources (DPNR) to discuss payments from the J Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation (also called Enhanced Education) to settle fines and penalties.

events.title: FBI search of Epstein's island residence
events.description: FBI agents searched Epstein's island residence off St. Thomas shortly after his death, which was confirmed by the FBI office.

events.title: FBI visit to Southern Trust offices
events.description: FBI agents visited the offices of Southern Trust (formerly Financial Trust) in the Red Hook Quarter of St. Thomas, according to an eyewitness report.

events.title: New York Times inquiry to FBI
events.description: Matthew Goldstein of The New York Times sent an email to FBI contacts seeking confirmation of the FBI's investigations into Epstein foundation payments and searches in the Virgin Islands, working on a deadline for a story.

locations: Epstein's island residence off St. Thomas
keyFacts: FBI agents met with Virgin Islands DPNR officials in mid-August 2019 to discuss a $160,000 payment from the J Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation (also called Enhanced Education) to settle fines, drawn on a FirstBank account in St. Thomas.
The FBI confirmed searching Epstein's island residence off St. Thomas shortly after his death in August 2019.
FBI agents reportedly visited the offices of Southern Trust (formerly Financial Trust) in the Red Hook Quarter of St. Thomas in mid-August 2019.
The New York Times was investigating Epstein's money trail, specifically issues with one of his foundations, and sought FBI confirmation for its reporting.
The FBI declined to provide further information beyond what was publicly available, citing the ongoing investigation.
